content.description: Climb up the center of the face oriented toward Harpers Ferry. Follow the small flake system until it ends, then continue straight up to the small summit.
content.protection: Be prepared to leave your own anchor or downclimb the backside of the pillar (5.1-ish).
content.location: Climbs up the center of the face/side of the pillar that faces Harpers Ferry.

content.description: Climb up the slightly overhanging wall on the upstream side of the pillar, finishing on a short vertical crack.
content.location: Be prepared to leave your own anchor and rappel or downclimb the backside of the pillar (5.1-ish).

content.description: Climb up the crack and the left edge to an overhang to gain the summit.   This route is a potential downclimb from the top of the pillar, after climbing this or one of the other routes.
content.location: From where the trail meets the rock on the down river side of the pillar.

content.description: A freestanding pillar (column) upriver from the Sign Wall of the main Maryland Heights cliffs.
